main event: Multiple observations of unidentified flying objects by U.S. Air Force personnel over Korea in April 1953.
interesting points: The first observation was by a pilot who reported a silver elongated object traveling at a speed of 600-800 knots at 30,000 feet, The object was in sight for approximately 15 seconds, A flat oval object was observed for about 3 hours flying in a straight line before hovering and flying away, Weather conditions during one observation were clear with no moon, The conclusion of one report deemed the object an astronomical phenomenon (star or meteor).
witness description: U.S. Air Force officers and pilots
